status_reasons.description: CloudWatch alarms do not exist in the account

securityhub_findings.description: The version of openssl found on instance i-abcd1234 is known to contain a vulnerability.

note.text: Don't forget to check under the mat.

recommendation.text: Run sudo yum update and cross your fingers and toes.

securityhub_findings.title: EC2.20 Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection should be up

securityhub_findings.description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.

types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices

recommendation.text: For directions on how to fix this issue, consult the AWS Security Hub Foundational Security Best Practices documentation.

securityhub_findings.title: EC2.8 EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices

status_reasons.description: This finding has a compliance status of NOT AVAILABLE because AWS Config sent Security Hub a finding with a compliance state of Not Applicable. The potential reasons for a Not Applicable finding from Config are that (1) a resource has been moved out of scope of the Config rule; (2) the Config rule has been deleted; (3) the resource has been deleted; or (4) the logic of the Config rule itself includes scenarios where Not Applicable is returned. The specific reason why Not Applicable is returned is not available in the Config rule evaluation.

securityhub_findings.description: This AWS control checks whether the EBS volumes that are in an attached state are encrypted.

The specific reason why Not Applicable is returned is not available in the Config rule evaluation.
